head.supplied: February 22nd [186]5 ¶ Dear Dr Mueller ¶ ¶ Your valued letter of the 20th ¶ I laid before the Council yesterday who have requested me to reply to certain parts of it. In the first place about the ro...

div.p: No. 65/, unit 4, p. 241, VPRS 2225 outward letterpress copy books, Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

The letter is not numbered within the series; it is one of four letters between 65/146 and 65/150. While the file copy is not signed, it is in Sprigg's handwriting. February 22nd [186]5
editorial addition.

Your valued letter of the 20th
Letter not found. I laid before the Council yesterday who have requested me to reply to certain parts of it. In the first place about the roads in the Royal Park the Council are extremely adverse to expend any portion of the Society's income in the repair of these roads and they have requested me to bring it before the Trustees. Will you therefore kindly call a meeting of the Trustees after the departure of the [mail] in order that some steps may be taken on the matter.

The Superintendent has also requested instructions as to how far his authority goes in keeping certain […]
illegible.
out of the Park and this is of course a matter relating solely to the Trustees.

The Council are very desirous to liberate the [quail] recently received before they become too tame, that is if their plumage is in a condition to warrant such a step
Presumably the seven Californian mountain quail, announced as received at the Botanic Garden in M to Acclimatisation Society of Victoria, February 1865 (in this edition as 65-02-00d). Of the […]
illegible.
you will inform me.
